org.apache.gora.util

Class ByteUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gora.util.ByteUtils

  • public class ByteUtils
extends Object
    Utility class that handles byte arrays, conversions to/from other types.

    • Method Detail

      • putBytes

        public static int putBytes(byte[] tgtBytes,
                           int tgtOffset,
                           byte[] srcBytes,
                           int srcOffset,
                           int srcLength)
        Put bytes at the specified byte array position.
        Parameters:
        tgtBytes - the byte array which source/input bytes are written.
        tgtOffset - offset position in the array to be considered to write bytes.
        srcBytes - source of byte to write out on target byte array.
        srcOffset - offset of source byte array to be considered.
        srcLength - length from offset of source byte array to be considered.
        Returns:
        incremented offset.

      • putByte

        public static int putByte(byte[] bytes,
                          int offset,
                          byte b)
        Write a single byte out to the specified byte array position.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array input.
        offset - position in the array.
        b - byte to write out.
        Returns:
        incremented offset.

        public static byte[] toBytes(ByteBuffer bb)
        Returns a new byte array, copied from the passed ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        bb - A ByteBuffer as input.
        Returns:
        the byte array of bb.

      • toString

        public static String toString(byte[] b)
        Converts a byte array to it s String representation.
        Parameters:
        b - Presumed UTF-8 encoded byte array.
        Returns:
        String made from b.

      • toString

        public static String toString(byte[] b1,
                              String sep,
                              byte[] b2)
        Converts two byte array given a separator string in between to single String representation.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Presumed UTF-8 encoded byte array input 1.
        b2 - Presumed UTF-8 encoded byte array input 2.
        sep - Separator String.
        Returns:
        String made from b1+sep+b2.

      • toString

                              int off,
                              int len)
        Converts byte array given offset and length to it s String representation.
        Parameters:
        b - Presumed UTF-8 encoded byte array.
        off - offset to be from the input byte array.
        len - length to be considered from the offset.
        Returns:
        String made from b.

      • readVLong

        public static long readVLong(byte[] buffer,
                             int offset)
                      throws IOException
        Reads a zero-compressed encoded long from input stream and returns it.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Binary input array.
        offset - Offset into array at which vint begins.
        Returns:
        deserialized long from stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - when read error occurs while extracting data from input stream.

      • compareTo

        public static int compareTo(byte[] left,
                            byte[] right)
        Compare byte two byte arrays, and returns a int value accordingly.
        Parameters:
        left - left byte array to be considered.
        right - right byte array to be considered.
        Returns:
        0 if equal, < 0 if left is less than right, etc.

      • compareTo

        public static int compareTo(byte[] b1,
                            int s1,
                            int l1,
                            byte[] b2,
                            int s2,
                            int l2)
        Compare byte two byte arrays given offset and length, and returns a int value accordingly.
        Parameters:
        b1 - left byte array to be considered.
        b2 - right byte array to be considered.
        s1 - Where to start comparing in the left buffer.
        s2 - Where to start comparing in the right buffer.
        l1 - How much to compare from the left buffer.
        l2 - How much to compare from the right buffer.
        Returns:
        0 if equal, < 0 if left is less than right, etc.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(byte[] left,
                             byte[] right)
        Compare byte two byte arrays for equality, and returns a boolean value accordingly.
        Parameters:
        left - left byte array to be considered.
        right - right byte array to be considered.
        Returns:
        True if equal.

                       throws IOException
